Round 18
This round's product is high-quality.
A new potential buyer has arrived!
Decide whether to recommend the buyer to buy the product.
response:
Since the buyer is asking for the probability of a product being high-quality, I'll provide that information. Given that 6 out of 17 products sold so far were high-quality, and the probability of a product being high-quality is 80% (as stated at the beginning), I can use Bayes' theorem to update the probability based on the observed data.

Let's calculate the posterior probability:

P(high-quality | 6/17) = (6/17) / (6/17 + (17-6)/17) = 6/12 = 0.5

So, the updated probability of a product being high-quality is approximately 50%.

 {"decision": "yes"}
